pr_title: Modify message at the duplicates found dialog

timeline.message: Modify message at the duplicates found dialog

timeline.bodyText: Auto merge is probably not the right name for the button, since the new entry is just imported next to the old one if I remember correctly.
timeline.author: tobiasdiez
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -119,10 +119,10 @@ public void importEntries(List<BibEntry> entriesToImport, boolean shouldDownload
                                                      .anyMatch(this::hasDuplicate)).onSuccess(duplicateFound -> {
                 if (duplicateFound) {
                     boolean continueImport = dialogService.showConfirmationDialogWithOptOutAndWait(Localization.lang("Duplicates found"),
-                            Localization.lang("There are possible duplicates (marked with an icon) that haven't been resolved. Continue?"),
-                            Localization.lang("Continue with import"),
+                            Localization.lang("There are possible duplicates that haven't been resolved. Continue?"),
+                            Localization.lang("Auto merge"),

replies.bodyText: Re-Import would be a better name?
replies.author: JofielB

replies.bodyText:
It's difficult, because its not a duplicate for sure, but JabRef only thinks, it is a duplicate. It is only a guess.
The user has to choice to think if they really want to import that stuff or not. No further information, how many entries are duplicates, which ones are duplicates, ... The dialog as is is not that helpful.
In other words: JabRef does not do any auto merge at all. It is also not a re-import, because the duplicates might not be "real" duplicates (letter-by-letter).
The decision the user has to take is: "Continue processing and all entries indepdenent of them being new ones or duplicates" or "Cancel import and leave the database as is"
These texts are too long for a button. Thus, we thought that "Continue with import" is a good word.
WDYT?
replies.author: koppor

replies.bodyText: Based on the current behavior of the app I believe is better to leave the previous message ("Continue with import"), I feel that is more descriptive of what is going to happen.
replies.author: JofielB

timeline.bodyText:
Please replace in all files where this string is used:
Hint: Use Ctrl+Shift+F to search in all files
timeline.author: koppor
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -119,10 +119,10 @@ public void importEntries(List<BibEntry> entriesToImport, boolean shouldDownload
                                                      .anyMatch(this::hasDuplicate)).onSuccess(duplicateFound -> {
                 if (duplicateFound) {
                     boolean continueImport = dialogService.showConfirmationDialogWithOptOutAndWait(Localization.lang("Duplicates found"),
-                            Localization.lang("There are possible duplicates (marked with an icon) that haven't been resolved. Continue?"),
-                            Localization.lang("Continue with import"),
+                            Localization.lang("There are possible duplicates that haven't been resolved. Continue?"),
+                            Localization.lang("Auto merge"),
                             Localization.lang("Cancel import"),
-                            Localization.lang("Disable this confirmation dialog"),
+                            Localization.lang("Do not ask again"),

timeline.message:
Modify the duplicates found dialog and change a concurrent message
- In the duplicate dialog from ImportEntriesViewModel change the
  Auto merge text to Continue with importer

- Change the text: "Disable this confirmation dialog" to:
  "Do not ask again" in all the project
